intro: Derderia, commonly known as the desert star, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. They are characterized by their compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that often appear in shades of white or yellow. Derderia species typically have finely divided leaves and are adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. They are sometimes cultivated as ornamental plants due to their unique appearance and drought tolerance.
